#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Develop an IT Risk‐Management Policy
#Text=Information Technology ( IT ) risk management is the ongoing process that protects data against unauthorized access or changes .
#Text=Developing an IT risk-management policy will provide a business or organization with the security to handle customers ' sensitive data and Internal files and to complete transactions safely .
#Text=The policy-development process weighs risks and controls with regard to effectiveness and cost , and it analyzes changes in existing policies , government regulations , and laws .
#Text=Consider the following as you learn how to develop an IT risk-management policy .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Catalog your organization 's assets as they relate to the IT department .
#Text=Consider your servers , computers , data , smart phones , routers , software , emails , files , networks , and website .
#Text=Determine what threats each asset may face .
#Text=Common or newly identified vulnerabilities can often be identified with the help of online forums and IT networking sites .

#Text=Consider threats from humans ( hackers , competitors , user errors ) , technical systems ( crashes , overloads , viruses ) , and the environment ( natural disasters like floods , hurricanes , and earthquakes ) .
#Text=Estimate the cost of managing each foreseeable threat .
#Text=Consider the loss of access , confidentiality , and reputation in connection with potential breaches .
#Text=Any interruption in commerce , lawsuit , or breach of trust can be quantified as a cost .
#Text=Anticipate the occurrence of such threats , and calculate the foreseeable cost of each , considering how often it might occur .
#Text=Determine controls which could mitigate each risk .
#Text=Estimate the cost of each control .
#Text=Multiply that figure by the estimated occurrence rate to come up with the long-term cost of each control .
#Text=Compare the costs of each risk and its corresponding control in a cost-benefit analysis .
#Text=Implement the risk controls that are cost effective .
#Text=Educate all users of the IT system on new controls , policies , and procedures that have been put in place to mitigate risk .
#Text=Create a system to track how risk-management controls are being implemented , who is checking on them , and how vulnerabilities have been addressed .
#Text=Designing a form for all users to fill out will ensure that the same data are collected on each evaluation and incident for future planning and evaluation purposes .
#Text=Set up a monitoring process to review all risks , and evaluate how controls and costs have balanced out .
#Text=Appointing one department or job position to head up the evaluation process can ensure timeliness and accountability .
#Text=Revisit your risk-management policy on a regular basis .
#Text=Evaluate its effectiveness , revising and editing the plan as necessary , particularly in response to any changes in business processes or to the risk environment. .
#Text=Risk management should be talked about and viewed as a continuous process that underlies all decisions and practices throughout the organization .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Be sure that all of your plans to avoid risks maintain compliance with the law and whatever regulating agencies pertain to your field of work .
#Text=External audits can provide valuable , unbiased feedback on weaknesses in IT risk- management policies .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=No IT system can be considered completely risk-free .
#Text=Risk management should continuously evolve with the emergence of new technologies and regulations .
#Text=Your organization 's assessment of what is considered acceptable risk should be conducted in consultation with your board of directors , leadership staff , and insurance provider .
#Text=Consider any access former employees might have to sensitive information .
#Text=Think of such people as potential vulnerabilities .
#Text=Monitoring the exit process of staff members and safeguarding confidentiality are integral parts of your IT risk-management policy .
